results.title: Family of man
results.brief_description: A portrayal of the “Family of Man” exhibit on display in the US in 1955 and in Australia in which Edward Steichen describes and demonstrates various exhibit panels, and explains how photography can be used as an art medium to show the universal oneness and goodness of mankind.

results.title: Family day care
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Additional credits are: script- Karl McPhee; photographer- John Hosking; editor- Karl Sodersten; sound- Max Hensser, Julian Ellingworth. Pam Goodwin is one of the co-ordinators of a Family Day Care Program. Her job entails interviewing parents and helping them find the kind of care that they want for their children, and interviewing the women who want to mind children and helping them in this role.

results.title: Family camping
results.creator_credit: Edmund Reid and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For the family on a camping vacation for the first time, or even for the experienced camper, this color film is a congenial and informative guide. It shows popular forms of camping: site camping; a hiking trip; canoe camping in the backwoods; cruise camping through more travelled waters; and trail riding in the Rockies. Each is seen to have its own attractions.

results.title: A Family affair: conflict
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: An 18 year-old boy leaves home against his parents’ wishes to work in a summer theatre. This aggravates the tense family atmosphere which results from an over-anxious and over-possessive mother and a father who is frustrated and withdrawn into himself. They both agree to seek help from a social case-worker who helps them to continue marriage as responsible adults. When the teenage daughter wishes to go out with someone of whom mother does not approve, father is able to persuade mother that the girl should be allowed to make her own mistakes.

results.title: A Family affair
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, Helen De Mourpied and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A plea for foster-parents to take in orphaned, neglected or deserted children. Shows conditions in a special home; points out some of the personal difficulties faced by such children; maintains that only a place in a real family will allow these children a full and free life; examples of a husband and wife who took in six children of various ages at the one time.

results.title: The Family
results.creator_credit: Herbert Kerkow and United States. Army
results.brief_description: Family life as lived by a father, mother, two children and a grandmother is depicted. They are not in affluent circumstances and conflicts arise because the father wants to repair the house, mother wants a sewing machine, and the daughter a ball dress. They get together and talk out their problems; by so doing they strengthen the bonds of family life and create a sense of security among themselves.

results.title: La Familie Martin
results.brief_description: Introduces a typical Parisian family of mother, father, two sons and a daughter and tells the story of the daughter’s return by air from a holiday in England. Commentary and dialogue in French.

results.title: Une Famille Bretonne
results.brief_description: Part of the French Language Series, this is the story of the film “French children” told in simple French by a teacher-narrator, born in France. Told in the present tense and avoiding all subjunctives, the narration is levelled at the needs of beginners and provides practice in the understanding of spoken French. The film portrays family life on a farm in Brittany. It illustrates the work of each member of the family and includes scenes of the village school and a neighbouring town.

results.title: Families get angry
results.creator_credit: Delton Cook, John Simons and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: A family quarrel begins when the father in a black, low-income family is trying to stretch too little money to pay too many bills. The two children are strongly affected by their parents’ conflict.
